comments:
The 3.0M3 build is failing to startup on my Solaris 8 system running JDK
1.4.2_01.  The stacktrace follows:

java.lang.UnsatisfiedLinkError:
/opt/eclipse/plugins/org.eclipse.swt.motif_3.0.0/os/solaris/sparc/libswt-motif-3019.so:
ld.so.1: /usr/local/bin/java: fatal: libXp.so.1: open failed: No such file or
directory
        at java.lang.ClassLoader$NativeLibrary.load(Native Method)
        at java.lang.ClassLoader.loadLibrary0(ClassLoader.java:1560)
        at java.lang.ClassLoader.loadLibrary(ClassLoader.java:1469)
        at java.lang.Runtime.loadLibrary0(Runtime.java:788)
        at java.lang.System.loadLibrary(System.java:834)
        at org.eclipse.swt.internal.Library.loadLibrary(Library.java:108)
        at org.eclipse.swt.internal.motif.OS.<clinit>(OS.java:20)
        at org.eclipse.swt.widgets.Display.createDisplay(Display.java:614)
        at org.eclipse.swt.widgets.Display.create(Display.java:600)
        at org.eclipse.swt.graphics.Device.<init>(Device.java:126)
        at org.eclipse.swt.widgets.Display.<init>(Display.java:350)
        at org.eclipse.swt.widgets.Display.<init>(Display.java:347)
        at org.eclipse.ui.internal.Workbench.run(Workbench.java:1989)
        at
org.eclipse.core.internal.boot.InternalBootLoader.run(InternalBootLoader.java:858)
        at org.eclipse.core.boot.BootLoader.run(BootLoader.java:461)
        at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke0(Native Method)
        at
sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(NativeMethodAccessorImpl.java:39)
        at
sun.reflect.DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.java:25)
        at java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke(Method.java:324)
        at org.eclipse.core.launcher.Main.basicRun(Main.java:295)
        at org.eclipse.core.launcher.Main.run(Main.java:751)
        at org.eclipse.core.launcher.Main.main(Main.java:587)

Please advise.
Failure loading SWT's native library. Moving to SWT for comments.

The Xprint library is not being found since it hasn't been explicitly installed 
on your box.  This is a problem with our library which will be fixed quite 
soon.  In the meantime you can work around this by adding /usr/openwin/lib to 
your LD_LIBRARY_PATH before running Eclipse.

This is also a problem in the most recent 2.1.2 build, so the fix needs to go 
into both streams.  The fix for previous bug 40490 introduced a 2.1.2 
regression that makes Eclipse no longer run on Solaris if Xprint is not 
installed, which is quite bad (bug 40490 fixed the scenario in which Xprint was 
installed and active in the background).

The fix is to add /usr/openwin/lib to the dynamic library search path of the 
swt library, since in the Xprint-not-installed case this is the only location 
where libXp.so lives.  So it's a change to our makefile and the swt library.

For reference see http://xprint.mozdev.org/bugs/show_bug.cgi?id=4195
Solaris stores all X11 libs in /usr/openwin/lib, entries in /usr/libs are only
softlinks to the files in /usr/openwin/lib

Their should be one bug per version, or how will people searching for changes to
3.0 know that this was fixed? their is no 3x level target.  unless i don't
understand bugzilla correctly.

traces.message: /opt/eclipse/plugins/org.eclipse.swt.motif_3.0.0/os/solaris/sparc/libswt-motif-3019.so: ld.so.1: /usr/local/bin/java: fatal: libXp.so.1: open failed: No such file or directory
